description: Lymphangioma Circumscriptum is a rare type of lymphatic malformation that affects the skin and is characterized by the presence of small, fluid-filled sacs called lymphatic vessels.
possible causes: Abnormal development of lymphatic vessels during fetal development
Trauma or injury to the lymphatic system
symptoms: Small, clear or yellowish fluid-filled vesicles on the skin
Swelling or puffiness in the affected area
treatments: Surgical removal of the affected tissue
Sclerotherapy to shrink the lymphatic vessels
